frame.name: Needing
frame.definition:
<def-root>The speaker believes that some state of affairs or entity (the <fen>Requirement</fen>) must be present in order to cause some other dependent state of affairs to occur (the <fen>Dependent</fen>). In the typical case, the <fen>Cognizer</fen> desires the occurrence of the <fen>Dependent</fen> and so also desires the obtainment or occurrence of the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
<ex><fex name="cog">I</fex> <t>need</t> <fex name="req">one more bolt</fex>. <fex name="dep">DNI</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="cog">I</fex> <t>need</t> <fex name="req">one more nail</fex> <fex name="dep">to finish building the cabinet</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="dep">In order to complete the treaty</fex>, <fex name="cog">the United States</fex> will <t>require</t> <fex name="req">several more diplomats</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="cog">He</fex> <t>needs</t> <fex name="req">everyone to leave his office</fex> <fex name="dep">to finish his work</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The Cognizer requires or believes he/she requires the Requirement to hold so that the Dependent will occur.</def-root>

FE.name: Requirement
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity or state-of-affairs that must be present or obtain in order for the Dependent to obtain.</def-root>

FE.name: Dependent
FE.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affairs which cannot hold without the <fen>Requirement</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Some specification of the conditions under which the <fen>Requirement</fen> is likely to be needed.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Dependent</fen> depends on the presence of the <fen>Requirement</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> requires the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
<ex>I <t>need</t> that book <fex name="tim">now</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> when he/she requires the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
<ex><fex name="pla">Over at Merv's house</fex> they <t>need</t> three more cement trucks to finish the job.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Consequences
FE.definition:
<def-root>An undesirable state-of-affairs that results if the <fen>Requirement</fen> is not met.
<ex>He <t>needs</t> to focus on his schoolwork, <fex name="con">or he's not going to pass the third grade</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a need per some unit of time. </def-root>

FE.name: Iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>The frame element Iteration is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: need.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: require (something) because it is essential or very important rather than just desirable.

lexUnit.name: require.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: have a believe that some object or state is necessary for some other (desirable) state to obtain.

lexUnit.name: need.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a necessary or required circumstances or situation.
